Articles.Content:
Cool video I made, announcing the youtube series I would be making:

Overview/backstory:

A while ago, I saw the Jool-5 challenge thread. Intrigued, I started to plan my mission. I regularly visited the thread, to see what the challenges were that I had to complete. I then saw someone went to every planet for their entry. When I saw what could be done, I was inspired to do something similar.

I have been playing KSP since 0.21.1, and only recently have I sent probes to the other planets. I still have yet to even encounter the two dwarf planets, land on any moons other than the Mun and minmus and other planets (except Duna) legitimately. The 'Kerbol Program' aims to have multiple kerbals landing on every object in the Kerbol system and returning them safely back to kerbin.

Construction:

Unlike other entries in the Jool-5 challenge, my mission will use an asteroid (a LARGE asteroid) as a core. I will also use probes to map the planets to choose a landing spot, along with basic landers for targets. Of course, it will use multiple modules for fuel, science and landers.

Images:

I currently have yet to make any images or videos showing my progress.
